bug.summary: slider with step=2 and odd numbers returns even values
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Slider with step=2 and odd numbers returns even values, while one would expect odd values. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st st.slider("test", 11, 21, value=15, step=2) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I would expect to have odd values from 11 to 21. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
I get even values, except for limits (11 and 21) <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Cannot say. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.57.3 Python version: 3.6.10 Using Conda OS version: macOS 10.14 Browser version: Firefox 76

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/H4dr1en>@H4dr1en</denchmark-link> , it's been fixed in a more recent release. Can you upgrade?
